intro: Carthamodes pectinata, commonly known as the woolly sunflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its dense, fuzzy leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Its unique appearance and ability to attract pollinators make it a valuable addition to ecological landscapes.
